goal.ch: 經由個別教師所精選的內容，使學生具備當代原子與光學物理的基礎與前瞻眼光，預備後續在原子與光學物理先進研究的能力。
goal.en: From the respective lecturers’ selected topics, the students should be equipped with fundamental concepts and visions in “Recent Trends in Atomic and Optical Physics”, as well as be prepared for further advanced research capability in atomic and optical physics.

outline.ch:
Part 1 (4 lectures): 介紹基本的原子與光場交互作用，以及一些現代冷原子物理的應用，課程主要包含 (1) 二能極原子與電磁場交互作用，從物理的圖像推導致光學布洛赫方程式，(2) 雷射冷卻與原子捕捉。
Part 2 (3 lectures): 經由光量子操控原子，量子資訊處理與量子通訊。
Part 3 (4 lectures): 三能極電磁場誘發穿透透明的原子與光場交互作用；慢光效應、光儲存與光量子記憶體；用光控制光在四能極N組態原子系統。
Part 4 (2 lectures): 玻色凝聚態的統計力學性質；量子氣體，即原子玻色凝聚態的穩態與動態性質；目前原子玻色凝聚態的傳統實驗探測方法與近年研究領域的亮點討論。
Part 5 (3 lectures):雷射光譜簡介，包含量化光譜、前沿光譜技術以及光頻梳光譜之發展與應用等。
outline.en:
•Part 1 (4 lectures): I shall introduce basic atom-field interaction and few applications in modern cold atom physics. The lecture will cover (1) two-level atom interacting with an electromagnetic field, from physical picture to Optical Bloch Equation formalism, and (2) laser cooling and atom trapping.
•Part 2 (3 lectures): Quantum control of atoms by light. Quantum information processing and quantum communication.
•Part 3 (4 lectures): Atom-field interactions in a three-level electromagnetically induced transparency system. Slow light, stored light and optical quantum memory. Controlling light by light in a four-level N-type atomic system.
•Part 4 (2 lectures): Theory of Bose-Einstein condensates (BECs) in statistical mechanics. Stationary states and dynamics of atomic BECs, which are dilute quantum gases. Typical experimental probing methods in current atomic BEC setups and recent research highlights in this field will be discussed.
•Part 5 (3 lectures): The main topic in my part will be introducing the laser spectroscopy, including quantitative spectroscopy, advanced spectroscopic techniques, and optical frequency comb spectroscopy.

gradMethod.en: Based on active participation and engagement during the class, homework and written quizzes. The final score will be given by the average of lecturer’s grades.
